--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin Green <cgreen@d...> wrote:

> >Possible solutions then.
> >1) Precalculate the size of the population, test for the zero case
and 
> >if so then keep the original species sizes.
> >2) Define a minimum fitness greater than 0. This is a bit bit of a
hack 
> >though really.
> >3) Keep generating initial populations until a none zero fitness
occurs.
> >
> >Thoughts?
> >

I've been using #2.  Actually, I think my version of NEAT will change
any fitness of 0 to 0.000001 or something like that. 

I think 1 is bad because it will lose all sense of proportionality
just from one individual having zero fitness.

3, on the other hand, could take forever;  the probability of getting
zero fitness may be so high that it is virtually impossible to
generate a population without it.

ken
